text: For anyone planning on downloading the data for DR. Races assignment, I would recommend you get the data from the Kaggle Website in the zipped folders containing each .csv

The way she posted it puts the .csv into a webpage and it takes an extremely long time to download the text and display it.  Because of this, it kept crashing Chrome after a few minutes of trying to load.

Link that <@U1LMHQY9E> and I found that shows the detail for manual calculations for a dendrogram, which is useful for the first machine learning practice problems. It's not too bad for a small number of points, but gets crazy complex pretty quickly.
<http://www.southampton.ac.uk/~re1u06/teaching/upgma/>

text: I'm looking at the question 3a on the exercise worksheet and part a is to calculate complete linkage, part b is to calculate using single linkage, so you may need to change the calculation while doing this
